page.title: 01KEIGHLEY - centre to south.
page.content: { Keighley}is an interesting place of contrasts. There's a{steam railway with restored engines, the Keighley & Worth Valley Light Railway. The stations on the line in our area are Ingrow and Damems. Keighley is a very hilly town, surrounded by moorland with a picturesque valley. Farms cover the hillsides. {Dry-stone walls}were used to split up the fields and you will see dry-stone walls wherever you look. The stone for the walls was quarried locally. There is also a lot of woodland in this area.{ } Keighley is not only a beautiful town, it is also{industrial,} with large{engineering works}and{housing {estates. Textile mills}were once powered by{North Beck's}water. There is also a large {supermarket}in our area.
